## Introduction to mapping in R (1): static maps

::: {.lead-para}
This presentation takes you through the basics of making a static map in R using `ggplot2` and `sf`.
:::

Table: Session details

| | |
|--:|--|
| Date | 29 November 2019 |
| Presenter | Matt Kerlogue |
| Abstract | An introduction to using R for statistical mapping. |
| Type | Methods demo |
| Level | 0: No experience necessary |

#### Details

The presentation uses the Cabinet Office's [Civil Service Statistics 2019](https://www.gov.uk/government/statistics/civil-service-statistics-2019) to demonstrate how to use `ggplot2` and `sf` to make a simple static map.

**View the presentation [here](https://mattkerlogue.github.io/mapping-in-r/static_map.html).**

Download the [Rmd/repo](https://github.com/mattkerlogue/mapping-in-r) to use the code yourself. Note you'll also need to install [xarignan](https://slides.yihui.name/xaringan/) if you want to build the slides yourself.
